p: The West African rainfall regime is linked to the seasonal movement of the intertropical convergence zone. The semi-arid zone, which essentially comprises the Sahelian and Sahelo-Saharan strip, is marked by a single rainy season between July and September. Further south, the alternation of two rainy seasons and two dry seasons marks the climate of the countries of the Gulf of Guinea [ 74]. These periods are also marked by an increase in humidity. The arrival of the rainy season in certain West Africa countries, moreover, will increase the humidity, which combined with heat could further reduce the spread of SARS CoV-2.
